column4: and now it appears in the list of VPN Connections when I click on my network icon in my panel/tray thing
but, when I select that VPN connection essentially "nothing happens"
i don't get a window, I don't get an error, I don't get an error window
just... nothing
how can I troubleshoot my vpn connection?
wich vpn server/client are you using?
openvpn
yes?
i answered your question
openvpn
where can I find the syntax for launching openvpn from the commandline?
everything can be executed by cl... just type openvpn --help

ok well I have a zip file that my sysadmin gave me with the certs and a conf file. I set up a connection in the VPN network manager and selected my certs, but I didn't see anywhere to specify my conf file
exctly
I've got a few vhosts set up on my work computer...
er... yah ok like how so? like what's an example command I should likely be able to run?
e.g. http://somesite.mydev/ and http://foosite.mydev/
once you are connected to the openvpn server, you should be able to communicate with the other hosts joined in the vpn
er... yeah, sorry to be so verbose but how? the openvpn output simply says Initialization Sequence Completed

you have a new network interface and can communicate with the other hosts of the same network depending how your sysad configured, you can check your virtual interface running the command ifconfig or ifconfig tap0
yes
